article.title: NASA Selects ITT to Develop Critical Sensors to Measure CO2 From Air, Space
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: ITT Corporation has been chosen by NASA to help design, develop and test a set of instruments to measure carbon dioxide (CO2) from air and space in support of NASA's Active Sensing of CO2 Emissions over Nights, Days and Season (ASCENDS) mission. ITT has received an initial contract for ASCENDS mission support for a period of five years with a total value of $7 million.
